Html: I know I may seem a little bit behind the times given the release of SQL Server 2008, but can anyone tell me where I can download the front-end application (either Windows-based or ASP.NET-based) to the SQL Server 2005 version of the AdventureWorks database (assuming a front-end application exists)?  Thanks in advance for any help.

When you say "front-end" do you mean store front? http://www.codeplex.com/MSFTEEProdSamples/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ReleaseId=4037

Or do you mean management utiltities? Like these:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=C243A5AE-4BD1-4E3D-94B8-5A0F62BF7796&displaylang=en

http://www.codeplex.com/SQLWebQuery/

http://www.codeplex.com/SQL2005SrvcMngr/

http://www.codeplex.com/sqlhost/

Sorry for not being more clear.  I meant store front (i.e., a turn-key application that utilizes the entire AdventureWorks database).  Is that what your first link will give me?
Thanks again.

There's a store front for SQL Server 2008 in the E2E samples: http://www.codeplex.com/MSFTEEProdSamples/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ReleaseId=4037

Note: It does not use the AdventureWorks2008 OLTP database; it uses the AdventureWorks OLTP database in SQL2008.AdventureWorks_OLTP_DB_v2005.x86.msi from http://www.codeplex.com/MSFTDBProdSamples/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ReleaseId=16040.

Thanks for the two links.  I really appreciate it.

So it appears that I need to purchase and install SQL Server 2008 in order to obtain the "store front" application for AdventureWorks (i.e., your first link).  Is that correct?

I'm also a little confused with respect to your second link.  Do I need to download SQL2008.AdventureWorks_OLTP_DB_v2005.x86.msi, too, or is it included as part of your first link?

Could you please clarify?  Thanks again.
Sorry for the confusion, I got my threads mixed up. The samples in http://www.codeplex.com/MSFTEEProdSamples/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ReleaseId=4037 will work with SQL Server 2005.
Thanks for the clarification, and thanks again for all your help.
